meanings.definition: Not transparent or translucent; impenetrable to light.
meanings.sent1: The window was opaque, blocking all sunlight from entering the room.
meanings.sent2: The curtains were made of an opaque fabric that kept the room dark.
meanings.sent3: I tried to see through the opaque glass, but all I could see was my own reflection.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like an opaque wall, impossible to see through.
meanings.sent5: The lake was opaque, reflecting the sky like a mirror.

meanings.definition: Not allowing light to pass through; not transparent.
meanings.sent1: The sunglasses had opaque lenses that protected his eyes from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The bottle was made of opaque plastic, so you couldn't see the liquid inside.
meanings.sent3: The mystery box was so opaque that no one could guess what was inside.
meanings.sent4: Her intentions were as opaque as a thick fog, impossible to see through.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds were so opaque that the sun couldn't shine through.

meanings.definition: Difficult to understand or explain; obscure.
meanings.sent1: The professor's explanation was so opaque that none of the students understood.
meanings.sent2: The contract's terms were written in an opaque language that confused everyone.
meanings.sent3: Trying to decipher his handwriting was like reading an opaque code.
meanings.sent4: Her motives remained opaque, leaving everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The meaning of the ancient text was as opaque as a riddle.
